step.name: css-formatter
step.short-description: Renders a document using CSS formating

description.para: The XML or HTML document to render.
The CSS stylesheets to use for the rendering.
Parameters used to control the rendering. The XProc specification does not define any parameters for this option. A specific XProc processor (or renderer used) might define its own.

The content-type (media type) of the rendition that appears on the result port. The default value is application/pdf. Whether any other formats are supported is implementation-defined and therefore dependent on the XProc processor and renderer used.
This option may include media type parameters as well (for instance application/pdf; charset=UTF-8).

summary.para: The step renders an XML or HTML document using CSS formatting, usually into PDF. The CSS stylesheets for this must be present on the stylesheet port. The resulting rendition appears, as a binary document, on the result port.

description.para: The step allows you to transform XML or HTML into some kind of rendition, usually PDF, by applying CSS formatting. Most likely, CSS Paged Media will be used.

In most cases, relies on an external CSS formatter. You’ll probably have to do some XProc processor dependent configuration before this step will work. Please consult the XProc processor documentation about this.
